forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear, with a low around 29. Northwest wind around 7 mph.

forecast.name: Saturday
forecast.shortForecast: Mostly Sunny then Slight Chance Light Rain
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain after 5pm. Mostly sunny, with a high near 46. West wind around 8 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As evening settles over Boston, the city is cloaked in a soft darkness, punctuated by the glimmers of urban life against an obscured horizon. The air is crisp, carrying a note of chill that speaks of the impending winter. Tonight, the sky will reveal itself in mostly clear stretches, inviting starlight to mingle with the glow of distant city lights, but the chill settles in with a low temperature where the air brushes against 29 degrees. A gentle northwest wind whispers through the streets, adding a briskness that may raise a shiver if one isn’t properly attired. 

Looking ahead to Saturday, the dawn will greet us with hints of sunshine, yet a subtle shift hints at the possibility of rain as the day presses on—perhaps just a gentle caress from the heavens post 5pm. The anticipated high of 46 degrees offers a reasonable reprieve, but an air of melancholy lingers as the chance of precipitation looms in the distance. As you prepare to step into the day, consider layering wisely—perhaps a warm sweater topped with a light waterproof jacket, perfect for the anticipated drizzle that may follow hours of modest sun. The world invites you to seize the opportunity for a leisurely walk, perhaps among the quiet streets of Beacon Hill or along the Esplanade’s banks, where falling leaves whisper tales of seasons past. A warm drink in hand, you might cherish the thoughts of November as you meander, contemplating the beauty of the city bathed in autumn’s muted tones.
